hero.title: Hunger as ‘public perception’?
hero.description: Pearl S. Buck perfectly captured the nature of hunger as a primeval motivation for humans when she wrote: “A hungry man can’t see right or wrong. He just sees food.”

primary.lead: Mourning the Death of Pope Francis "Lolo Kiko"
primary.title: 'The voice of God': Filipinos wrestle with death of Pope Francis
primary.description: Manila, Philippines — Church bells rang out across the Philippines early Monday evening as Asia's bastion of Catholicism mourned the death of Pope

secondary.title: Pope Francis: Philippines remembers 'Lolo Kiko' who braved a typhoon for them
secondary.description: Popes enjoy rockstar status in overwhelmingly Catholic Philippines. And yet, Pope Francis was special.

secondary.title: In a bastion of Catholicism, Filipinos mourn Pope Francis and wonder who comes next
secondary.description: The nation remembers pontiff’s trip to the Philippines, where he met Typhoon Haiyan survivors in a show of sympathy and humility

secondary.title: ‘Pope Jeep’ back in spotlight as Filipinos mourn Pope Francis’ passing
secondary.description: The vehicle was displayed at the compound of the Minor Basilica and National Shrine of Jesus Nazareno in Quiapo, Manila on Friday, April 25, before being moved to Santuario de San Antonio Parish in Makati City, where it will remain until Sunday, April 27.

carousel.title: Enter the weird and wonderful world of Philippine brutalism
carousel.description: Philippine brutalism is an architecture subgenre to be explored and admired; the brains and lens behind visual database Brutalist Pilipinas, Patrick Kasingsing, takes us on a tour

carousel.title: Will overseas Filipino workers sway the Philippines’ midterm elections?
carousel.description: Observers say mistrust of a newly introduced online voting system needs to be addressed to increase voter turnout among OFWs.

carousel.title: Why one woman self-deported from the US
carousel.description: Immigrants of colour encounter the idea of race and racism for the first time when they migrate to a place like the US

carousel.title: Alex Eala falls short of repeat upset bid vs world No. 2 Iga Swiatek
carousel.description: Filipina teen sensation Alex Eala comes close to pulling off another stunner, but five-time Grand Slam champion Iga Swiatek roars back from a set down in the Madrid Open
